result.execSummary:
The defendant Micayla C Sprader was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: If a Wisconsin State Prison sentence is imposed, outstanding financial obligations shall be paid from all prison wages money at a rate of 25% and the balance due as a condition of extended supervision.  If extended spervision is revoked or will discharge with financial obligations owing, a judgment shall be entered.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.

Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety.

Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol or controlled substance without a valid prescription and then take medication as prescribed.
Court grants expunction upon successful completion of the sentence.

Defendant shall participate in all counseling and/or treatment programs directed by the probation agent and comply with recommendations.

Defendant shall pay any supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample.

timeConds.notes: With Huber privileges consistent with the rules of the jail while the inmate maintains a minimum security status. The defendant, at the discretion of the Sheriff, may perform community service work as an inmate worker in the county jail and shall earn statutory good time for same. Court authorizes transfer to county jail convenient to employment or residence.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Micayla C Sprader

Def in person & by Atty Raymond l Edelstein.  Atty Mark D. Bensen appeared for State.  Clerk: EZ.  Case recalled at 11:59 a.m.  Guilty plea entered to Count 1,  Court dismissed Count 4 for read-in.  Court finds def guilty on Count 1 and enters judgment.

Def in person & by Atty Raymond l Edelstein.  Atty Mark D. Bensen appeared for State.  Clerk: EZ.  Court notes the amended criminal complaint does not apply to this defendant.  No contest plea entered to Count 1, Court will not accept No Contest plea on this case.

State request $750.00 cash bond, counsel request a signature bond.  Court orders $1,500.00 signature bond.   Preliminary hearing time limits waived.  Adjourned for position on preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for February 18, 2015 at 02:45 pm.
